items.title: I tested the Fairphone 6, and itâ€™s exactly the type of Android phone the US needs
items.summary: This is how smaller brands can really stand apart from Samsung and Apple.
items.body: Itâ€™s no secret that the North American smartphone market is far smaller than the rest of the world. I have a drawer full of Android phones Iâ€™ve purchased or reviewed over the years, but theyâ€™re all made by the same handful of companies. Apple and Samsung dominate the US smartphone industry, with Google and Motorola being the only other brands with significant market share. To be even remotely competitive with these giant players, small phone brands need to think outside the box. That means giving users something the big conglomerates canâ€™t. It could be a niche feature, novelty design, or clever value proposition.

items.title: 5 ways Video Boost keeps disappointing me on my Pixel 10 Pro
items.summary: Video Boost was supposed to solve the video problem on Pixels, but it remains slow, cumbersome, and unreliable.
items.body: Video Boost has been a staple of the Pixelâ€™s camera experience for two years now, helping us shoot clearer, more stable, better zoomed videos in challenging situations. For me, though, the feature hasnâ€™t always been part of my go-to tricks. I used it a lot when it first launched on the Pixel 8 Pro , then sort of forgot about it, then started using it again last summer. I fell in love with Video Boost again when I used it to catch a few videos during concerts. But for all that Iâ€™ve enjoyed about it, Iâ€™m just as annoyed by all of its limitations and slowness. Iâ€™d love to use Video Boost more on my Pixel 10 Pro XL , but itâ€™s clear that Google is gatekeeping the feature and stopping it from reaching its full potential.

items.title: Foldables are going mainstream in 2026. Hereâ€™s why Iâ€™m still not buying one
items.summary: I'm still not ready to buy into the foldable dream.
items.body: More than any previous year, 2026 is likely to be the biggest yet for foldable phones. Samsung is set to release the Galaxy Z TriFold, Motorola is launching its first book-style foldable with the Razr Fold, and â€” most importantly â€” Apple is expected to finally debut its long-awaited iPhone Fold. This is the big moment the foldable industry has been waiting for, and if you havenâ€™t bought a foldable yet , thereâ€™s a good chance 2026 will be the year that finally happens. At least for some people.

items.title: Mensik withdrawal sends Djokovic into last eight
items.summary: Novak Djokovic moves through to the Australian Open quarter-finals as fourth-round opponent Jakub Mensik pulls out with an abdominal injury.

items.title: Glentoran versus Cliftonville postponed
items.summary: Glentoran's Irish Premiership game with Cliftonville which was to be played on Sunday afternoon is postponed because of a waterlogged pitch.

items.title: Protests, pride and late celebrations in URC
items.summary: Despite the off-the-field drama, it turned out to be a decent return for Wales' four professional sides with two wins, a draw and agonising defeat.

items.title: 'I'm surprising myself' - altered serve 'important weapon' for Alcaraz
items.summary: World number one Carlos Alcaraz describes his serve as an "important weapon" as he continues his serene run to the Australian Open quarter-finals.

items.title: Google Driveâ€™s new â€˜Smartâ€™ AI features are forcing me to move all my private documents
items.summary: To something that doesn't force-feed me AI.
items.body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority When Google started its operations in the late 1990s, it set out to â€œorganize the worldâ€™s information and make it universally accessible and useful.â€ Despite continual, and sometimes secretive, iteration, the clause remains intact in its mission statement. With the AI boom, Google wants to make information accessible without any significant effort, and is extending these principles beyond web search. Last month, it extended the same altruistic virtues to Google Drive, where you now see AI overview-style summaries for your folders . With this change, Googleâ€™s AI will look through your folders, any directories within them, the files stored in them, and even the contents of those files, so you can find whatever youâ€™re looking for immediately. These â€œsmartâ€ features in Google Drive are available to all paying Gemini subscribers and Workspace users. Google says it saves time and helps you discover files buried under several layers of folders. But Iâ€™m deeply unsettled by Google raking through my files â€” especially without my explicit consent â€” and the only solution I feel I have now is to stop trusting Google with anything private.

items.title: Why Â£67m Eze has been battling for Arsenal minutes
items.summary: Arsenal spent a lot of money to sign Eberechi Eze in August - but his Premier League game time has dropped off of late. BBC Sport examines why.

items.title: Why Carrick's Man Utd coaches are more than just 'a bunch of his mates'
items.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains the thinking behind Michael Carrick's backroom staff appointments at Manchester United, and what a manager wants from those roles.

items.title: 'I know my role' - O'Sullivan on Liverpool challenge
items.summary: It was an "emotional" decision by Denise O'Sullivan to leave North Carolina Courage but the challenge at Liverpool was an exciting one.

items.title: Kim leads Scheffler and teenager Brown by one shot
items.summary: South Korea's Si-Woo Kim moves into a one-shot lead over Scottie Scheffler and teenager Blades Brown after the third round of the American Express in California.

items.summary: Liverpool's struggles can no longer be hidden by their long unbeaten run after their last-gasp defeat at Bournemouth, writes Aadam Patel.

items.title: UGREENâ€™s Uno 65W GaN charger is just $34 right now, and itâ€™s kind of cute
items.summary: Save 31% on a highly-rated wall charger that's both powerful and adorable.
items.body: Credit: Amazon As your desk becomes more cluttered with your phone, laptop, tablet, and who knows what else, a multi-port wall charger can make life a lot easier. But it needs to tick the right boxes, and if it looks like a cute little robot, thatâ€™s just a bonus. This Amazon deal might be just the thing, as the UGREEN Uno 65W GaN charger is down to just $34.49 right now. UGREEN Uno 65W 3-Port GaN Fast Charger for $34.49 ($16 off)

items.title: Iâ€™m a Gboard loyalist, but a week with SwiftKey might have changed my mind
items.summary: Have I been sleeping on Microsoftâ€™s Android keyboard all this time?
items.body: Last year, I wrote an article about the Android apps I recommend to non-techies . In that piece, my keyboard pick was Gboard, thanks to its ease of use. However, not every reader agreed with me, and some mentioned a name I hadnâ€™t heard (or used) in years: SwiftKey . I was once an avid SwiftKey user, opting for the innovative keyboard early in my Android journey over Googleâ€™s simpler default option. The allure of the more efficient and sensibly designed Google alternative eventually drew me away as I upgraded to more polished devices. But, given that weâ€™ve just started a new year, could the reverse be true? Could SwiftKey challenge Gboard on my devices going forward?

items.title: GB's Brookes and Atkin claim X Games golds
items.summary: Great Britain's Zoe Atkin claims her second X Games freeski title and Mia Brookes wins gold in the women's snowboard slopestyle competition in Aspen, Colorado.

items.title: Digital minimalist: 5 apps I recommend for a clutter-free experience
items.summary: A minimalist app can actually make you more productive.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Itâ€™s excessive, isnâ€™t it? All those apps we use daily have way too many features, with new ones being added all the time. Going back to the basics isnâ€™t just good for your stress levels; it can also make you more productive. Take me, for example. I use Notion and have spent way too much time just setting up my system within the app, choosing the correct icons, and making sure the colors match across my pages. Because I spent so much time tweaking it, I feel like I have to put it to use, so I try to write down as much as humanly possible to achieve that feeling of being on top of things that matter. To be productive. Efficient. But honestly, itâ€™s starting to backfire. Not just with Notion, but with my other fancy â€” and expensive â€” apps as well.

items.title: OnePlus is denying shutdown rumors, but the Android world should still be worried
items.summary: Time to settle?
items.body: What in the world is going on with OnePlus? Thatâ€™s been the question on everyoneâ€™s mind for the last couple of weeks. Earlier this month, it was reported that OnePlus had canceled two of its most anticipated phones of 2026 : the OnePlus Open 2 and OnePlus 15s. This was followed by repeated teases from the same leaker that OnePlus was in trouble, along with another rumor claiming that the OnePlus 16 wonâ€™t get a global launch this year.

items.title: Tired of battery drain? Hereâ€™s why I switched from phone hotspots to a travel router
items.summary: My phone has other tasks that I want it to prioritize.
items.body: Turning your phone into a mobile hotspot by sharing its data connection is an undeniably useful feature, but it does come with certain drawbacks when compared to using a dedicated mobile router. I generally avoid hotel, shopping mall, and airport Wi-Fi. This is down to security and privacy reasons. Some public Wi-Fi providers require you to sign up for an account to use their network, and thereâ€™s the risk of data snooping. As a result, I always use a mobile data connection when Iâ€™m out of the house. For quick outings, Iâ€™ll use my phone as a hotspot. But when Iâ€™m going to be out for a few hours, or Iâ€™m leaving for an overnight trip, I always use a mobile router instead.

items.title: Want to block ads on Android? Hereâ€™s why I use an app over Private DNS
items.summary: I crave control. This Android app gives me that and plenty more.
items.body: Keeping distracting ads from infiltrating my Android phone has become a necessity rather than a luxury. Blocking them not only saves me time and sanity, but also prevents me from miss-clicking a potentially malicious link that could prompt me to download a random app. This is more of an issue for inexperienced smartphone users , but itâ€™s nonetheless a core reason I prefer batting ads away rather than ignoring them. Iâ€™m not suggesting that ads arenâ€™t the source of essential cash flow for developers and services, but considering my experiences with deceitful ads and unskippable disruptions, Iâ€™ve taken a firm stand.

items.title: I tried Garminâ€™s new nutrition tracking, and itâ€™s a mess
items.summary: I'm no food photographer, and that's a problem.
items.body: If Iâ€™m being honest, Iâ€™m terrible at tracking my nutrition. The minute you ask me to install another app and start logging everything I eat is the moment you tend to lose me. Itâ€™s not because I donâ€™t care (Iâ€™m very conscious of what I eat), but rather because I donâ€™t want to take the time when I already have apps for my steps, sleep, stress, and whatever else. But when Garmin announced it would bring nutrition tracking into its Connect Plus experience, I decided I had to give it a try.

items.title: NASA Sets Briefings for SpaceX Crew-12 Mission to Space Station
items.summary: NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston. At 11 a.m. EST, mission leadership will discuss final launch and mission preparations in a news câ€¦
items.body: NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-12 crew, from left to right, is NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev. Credit: SpaceX NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston. At 11 a.m. EST, mission leadership will discuss final launch and mission preparations in a news conference that will stream on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel. Next, the crew of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-12 mission will participate in a virtual news conference from NASA Johnson crew quarters at 1 p.m., also on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel. Individual streams for each of the events will be available on that page. This is the final media opportunity with Crew-12 before they travel to NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida for launch. Crew-12 will carry NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway , ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev to the orbiting laboratory. The crew will launch aboard a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft on the companyâ€™s Faâ€¦

items.title: The secret is out on the OnePlus 15Tâ€™s camera specs
items.summary: It may not be much of an improvement over the OnePlus 13T/S.
items.body: Credit: Aamir Siddiqui / Android Authority TL;DR A leak has provided new details about the OnePlus 15T. The phone is said to have a 50MP main sensor, a 50MP telephoto lens, and a 16MP front camera. Itâ€™s also believed to have a 6.32-inch 1.5K resolution display and a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip. Despite the rumors that have been swirling around OnePlus recently, the company continues to work on its upcoming phones. One of those upcoming handsets is the OnePlus 15T. Weâ€™ve heard a few details about this phone already, but a new leak has shed some more light on the device. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: NASA Awards Global Modeling, Assimilation Support Contract
items.summary: NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agencyâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-deliveryâ€¦
items.body: Credit: NASA NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agencyâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract with a maximum ordering value of approximately $84 million with a five-year period of performance beginning March 15, 2026. Under this contract, the contractor will be responsible for supporting and maintaining NASA Goddardâ€™s Global Modeling and Assimilation Officeâ€™s Goddard Earth Observing System (GEOS) model and data assimilation system. Tasks include supporting the development and validation of individual model components within GEOS and the development and integration of external components like sea and land-ice models within the modeling and assimilation system. For information about NASA and other agency programs, visit: https://www.nasa.gov -end- Tiernan Doyle Headquarters, Washington 202-358-1600 tiernan.doyle@nasa.gov Rob Garner Goddard Space Flight Center, Greenbelt, Md. 301-286-5687 rob.garner@nasa.gov Share Details Last Updated Jan 2â€¦

items.title: Trump Mobile touts an â€˜Ultraâ€™ version of the phone you still donâ€™t have yet
items.summary: Fool me twice...
items.body: TL;DR A Trump Mobile executive teased a higher-end â€œT1 Ultraâ€ in a November interview. Thatâ€™s despite no one who ordered the original Trump phone having received it yet. The executive claims that customers are â€œeager to buy intoâ€ the successor. My colleague C. Scott Brown put down his $100 deposit for the Trump phone seven months ago, and it still hasnâ€™t turned up . At least he ordered it for professional reasons (I think), but no one who excitedly pre-ordered the T1 phone has seen any sign of it yet. That hasnâ€™t stopped Trump Mobile from thinking about what comes next. According to a company executive, a higher-end â€œT1 Ultraâ€ may also be in the works. The Verge spotted a largely overlooked interview from November with Trump Mobile executive Don Hendrickson. Speaking to Wireless Dealer Magazine at the time, Hendrickson teased a second phone before the first one had made it into customersâ€™ hands.

items.title: A popular Instapaper feature may soon start costing Kindle users
items.summary: User emails and a Reddit reply outline the upcoming change.
items.body: TL;DR Send to Kindle will become a Premium-only Instapaper feature starting February 19. An Instapaper representative confirmed details on Reddit, citing the ongoing costs of Amazonâ€™s email-based Kindle delivery. Instapaper Premium currently costs $5.99 per month or $59.99 per year. Instapaper users may soon need to pay extra to keep sending saved articles directly to their Kindle devices. Users report receiving an email from Instapaper announcing that its Send to Kindle feature will become exclusive to the serviceâ€™s Premium subscription starting February 19. News of the update also made its way to Reddit , where an Instapaper representative also joined the discussion to offer additional context around the decision. According to the company, the move is tied to the ongoing costs of maintaining Kindle delivery.

items.title: NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission
items.summary: NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II missionâ€™s journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASAâ€™s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep spâ€¦
items.body: 4 Min Read NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission A visual representation of NASA’s Artemis I mission. Credits: NASA NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II missionâ€™s journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASAâ€™s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep space. The agencyâ€™s second mission in the Artemis campaign is a key step in NASAâ€™s path toward establishing a long-term presence at the Moon and confirming the systems needed to support future lunar surface exploration and paving the way for the first crewed mission to Mars. While NASAâ€™s Near Space Network and Deep Space Network , coordinated by the agencyâ€™s SCaN (Space Communication and Navigation) program , will provide primary communications and tracking services to support Orionâ€™s launch, journey around the Moon, and return to Earth, participants selected from a request for proposals published in August 2025, comprised of established commercial service providers, members of academia, and individual amateur radio enthusiasts will use their respective â€¦

items.title: Anbernicâ€™s GBA SP-like handheld just lost half its memory
items.summary: This GBA SP clone just got a stealth RAM cut.
items.body: Credit: ANBERNIC TL;DR Anbernic quietly made a change to its Game Boy Advance SP-like RG34XXSP handheld. Previously, the RG34XXSP offered 2GB of RAM, now it only comes with 1GB. When contacted, Anbernicâ€™s support team confirmed the downgrade. Itâ€™s no secret that the industry is currently facing a RAM shortage , which threatens to raise the price of your next phone. However, itâ€™s not just phones that are affected by the shortage; itâ€™s any device that uses RAM. A recent downgrade to the Anbernic RG34XXSP may just be another end result of this situation. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert
items.summary: Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: During NASAâ€™s Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. At NASAâ€™s Johnson Sâ€¦
items.body: 3 Min Read I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager, sits in the OCSS Lab at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. Credits: NASA/Rad Sinyak Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: 0:00 / 0:00 Your browser does not support the audio element. During NASAâ€™s Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. At NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston, Dustin Gohmert leads the team responsible for these suits, known as the Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS). â€œWe work with the crew to say, â€˜Hereâ€™s this design concept we have. How does this really work in the spaceflight environment?â€™â€ Gohmert said. â€œAs we evolve the design, we take the crewâ€™s input and we adapt the suit over time to take into account not only the desire we have for safety, but the real-world impacts that it has.â€ The suits will protect astronauts on launch day, throughout high-risk parts of missions near the Moon, during the high-speed return to Earth, and in emergency situations if such events arâ€¦

items.title: Red, Green Light Show
items.summary: A green and red aurora streams across Earthâ€™s horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the â€¦
items.body: NASA/Chris Williams A green and red aurora streams across Earthâ€™s horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the image was captured. Also known as the northern lights ( aurora borealis ) or southern lights ( aurora australis ), auroras are colorful, dynamic, and often visually delicate displays of an intricate dance of particles and magnetism between the Sun and Earth called space weather. When energetic particles from space collide with atoms and molecules in the atmosphere, they can cause the colorful glow that we call auroras. Image credit: NASA/Chris Williams

items.title: Bought a Belkin power bank in the past decade? You may have some cash coming your way
items.summary: It's not exactly BIG money, but it is SOME money.
items.body: TL;DR Belkin has settled a class-action suit alleging it misrepresented the capacity of its power banks. Customers living in California who purchased power banks between 2014 and 2024 may be eligible to submit a claim. Claimants can expect to receive $2 cash, or a $5 Belkin credit. Is there any one component of mobile tech thatâ€™s responsible for more anxiety than batteries? When we arenâ€™t worried about the batteries in our phones catching fire , weâ€™re worried about them losing capacity over time . At the very least, weâ€™d love it if they accurately communicated their capacity to us, letting us know exactly what we can expect from them. Even that might be too big of an ask, though, and that issue is now core to a class-action settlement that could net Belkin customers a few bucks. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Does this headline even matter? Google Discover is writing its own with AI
items.summary: Hey, Google: Please stop doing this.
items.body: TL;DR Google Discover will continue applying AI-generated headlines to â€œtrending topicâ€ stories after experimenting with the idea in late 2025. Many of these headlines are low quality, often misrepresenting the stories theyâ€™re applied to. Aggregated trending topic stories are presented very similarly to normal news stories, which may lead readers to blame publishers for misleading or confusing titles. Been seeing bizarre, AI-generated headlines in Google Discover? Thatâ€™s not an accident, Google says. Following an initial experiment last year , the company has confirmed that it plans to continue using AI to whip up titles for certain stories that appear in the Discover feed that lives on Android home screens, without input from the people who write those stories or much attention paid to whether the generated headlines make any sense. As The Verge â€˜s Sean Hollister writes, Google has informed the publication that it will continue slapping AI-generated headlines on certain stories in Discover, a decision that, Google says, has been good for â€œuser satisfaction.â€

items.title: NASA Finds Lunar Regolith Limits Meteorites as Source of Earthâ€™s Water
items.summary: A new NASA study of its Apollo lunar soils clarifies the Moonâ€™s record of meteorite impacts and timing of water delivery. These findings place upper bounds on how much water meteorites could have supplied later in Earthâ€™s history. Research has previously shown that meteorites may have been a signifâ€¦
items.body: 4 min read NASA Finds Lunar Regolith Limits Meteorites as Source of Earthâ€™s Water A close-up view of a portion of a â€œrelatively freshâ€ crater, looking southeast, as photographed during the third Apollo 15 lunar surface moonwalk. Credit: NASA A new NASA study of its Apollo lunar soils clarifies the Moonâ€™s record of meteorite impacts and timing of water delivery. These findings place upper bounds on how much water meteorites could have supplied later in Earthâ€™s history. Research has previously shown that meteorites may have been a significant source of Earthâ€™s water as they bombarded our planet early in the solar systemâ€™s development. In a paper published Tuesday in the Proceedings to the National Academy of Sciences, researchers led by Tony Gargano, a postdoctoral fellow at NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center and the Lunar and Planetary Institute (LPI), both in Houston, used a novel method for analyzing the dusty debris that covers the Moonâ€™s surface called regolith . They learned that even under generous assumptions, meteorite delivery since about four billion years ago could only have supplied a small fraction of Earthâ€™s water. The Moon serves as an ancient archive of the impact history â€¦

items.title: NASAâ€™s Chandra Releases Deep Cut From Catalog of Cosmic Recordings
items.summary: Like a recording artist who has had a long career, NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory has a â€œback catalogâ€ of cosmic recordings that is impossible to replicate. To access these X-ray tracks, or observations, the ultimate compendium has been developed: the Chandra Source Catalog (CSC). The CSC containâ€¦
items.body: 5 Min Read NASA’s Chandra Releases Deep Cut From Catalog of Cosmic Recordings Like a recording artist who has had a long career,  NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory  has a â€œback catalogâ€ of cosmic recordings that is impossible to replicate. To access these X-ray tracks, or observations, the ultimate compendium has been developed: the  Chandra Source Catalog  (CSC). The CSC contains the  X-ray  data detected up to the end of 2020 by Chandra, the worldâ€™s premier X-ray telescope and one of NASAâ€™s â€œGreat Observatories.â€ The latest version of the CSC, known as CSC 2.1, contains over 400,000 unique compact and extended sources and over 1.3 million individual detections in X-ray light. before after This image contains lower-, medium-, and higher-energy X-rays in red, green, and blue respectively. NASA/CXC/SAO; Image Processing: NASA/CXC/SAO/N. Wolk This image is the sum of 86 observations added together, representing over three million seconds of Chandra observing time. It spans just about 60 light-years across, which is a veritable pinprick on the entire sky. The underlying image contains lower-, medium-, and higher-energy X-rays in red, green, and blueâ€¦

items.title: Beware: New Android malware uses AI to sneakily commit ad fraud on your phone (Update)
items.summary: But it's not even the worst part
items.body: TL;DR A newly discovered type of malware uses machine learning to automatically interact with ads and commit fraud. It can also be used to grant hackers access to your screen. The malware is found on certain games distributed through inappropriate app stores, but some have also been found in Xiaomiâ€™s GetApps app store. Update, January 23, 2025 (12:53 PM ET): Google has reached to Android Authority to comment on this malware. A spokesperson tells us: Based on our current detection, no apps containing this malware are found on Google Play. Android users are automatically protected against known versions of this malware by Google Play Protect, which is on by default on Android devices with Google Play Services. Google Play Protect can warn users or block apps known to exhibit malicious behavior, even when those apps come from sources outside of Play.

items.title: Googleâ€™s killing off the best Gmail feature you never knew about
items.summary: If you relied on Gmailify to keep other inboxes organized and spam-free, you'll need a new plan.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Gmailify is shutting down this month after almost a decade. Third-party email accounts will lose Gmail-style spam filtering, categories, and advanced search functions. Youâ€™ll still be able to access other inboxes in the Gmail app, just without the full Gmail experience. Itâ€™s the end of an era, at least it is for Google-feature stans. For nearly a decade, Google has offered a way to make non-Gmail inboxes feel a lot more like Gmail . That feature is called Gmailify, but itâ€™s now on the way out. According to an updated support page from Google , Gmailify will be discontinued this month. Once that happens, Gmail will no longer apply features like spam protection, inbox categories, advanced search, or enhanced notifications to third-party email accounts such as Yahoo or Outlook.

items.title: We asked, you answered: Hereâ€™s what you want from Googleâ€™s foldables in 2026
items.summary: Most of you expect a major overhaul.
items.body: Googleâ€™s third-generation foldable phone, the Pixel 10 Pro Fold , is a fine enough device on its own. But in context â€” coming as a follow-up to the Pixel 9 Pro Fold that made big improvements over the original Pixel Fold, and launching the same year as impressive competition from the likes of Vivo and Honor â€” the comparatively incremental 10 Pro Fold was a bit of a letdown for enthusiasts . Last month, we asked you all what you want to see from Googleâ€™s foldable efforts this year. Quite a few of you said youâ€™d be fine with more of the same â€” but many more are holding out for serious change.

items.title: This Galaxy Z Fold 8 rival will have a surprisingly early launch (Update: Battery details)
items.summary: The Magic V6 is launching months ahead of what was expected.
items.body: Credit: Paul Jones / Android Authority TL;DR HONOR has confirmed that the Magic V6 and Robot Phone will premiere at MWC 2026. The company will hold a launch event on March 1, 2026. HONOR also mentions that its â€œlatest all-scenario flagship devicesâ€ will join the Magic V6 and Robot Phone. Update: January 23, 2026 (12:10 PM ET): The HONOR Magic V6 was spotted on Chinaâ€™s 3C database. A screenshot of the certification (via Huawei Central ) reveals that the foldable has a rated capacity of around 7,000mAh, with a typical capacity of 7,150mAh (2,320mAh + 4,680mAh). It appears the Magic V6 will also have a variant that may have a 6700mAh battery with a typical value of 6850mAh. Original article: January 23, 2026 (11:40 AM ET): This yearâ€™s Mobile World Congress (MWC) event is scheduled to take place from March 2 to March 5. Among the various brands that will be at the show, HONOR has confirmed that it will also be in attendance. However, the company wonâ€™t be there just to keep an eye on the latest industry trends; it will also be launching a few devices.

items.title: Journey to Center of Milky Way With Upcoming NASA Roman Core Survey
items.summary: At the heart of our own galaxy, there is a dense thicket of stars with a supermassive black hole at the very center. NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will provide the deepest-ever view of this zone, revealing stars, planets, and unique objects that resist definition. Based on the input of aâ€¦
items.body: At the heart of our own galaxy, there is a dense thicket of stars with a supermassive black hole at the very center. NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will provide the deepest-ever view of this zone, revealing stars, planets, and unique objects that resist definition. Based on the input of astronomers from across the globe, the Roman Space Telescope will spend three-quarters of its five-year primary mission conducting three revolutionary surveys of unprecedented scale. Their combined results will transform all areas of astronomy and answer longstanding questions about dark matter, dark energy, and planets outside of our solar system, called exoplanets. That last theme will be addressed by the Galactic Bulge Time-Domain Survey, which will peer into the center of our galaxy to study the stars and exoplanets that make up the densely populated region around the center of the Milky Way, known as the galactic bulge. This infographic describes the Galactic Bulge Time-Domain Survey that will be conducted by NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope. The smallest of Romanâ€™s core surveys, this observation program will consist of repeat visits to six fields covering 1.7 square degrees â€¦

items.title: The Google Photos image editor now responds to your phoneâ€™s theme
items.summary: The editor used to have a dark background no matter what.
items.body: TL;DR The editing interface in Google Photos now supports a light-theme editing interface on Android. The editorâ€™s theme follows your device settings. We saw this change in development last year, but it seems to be rolling out broadly this week. Back in November, we spotted that Google was cooking up a new light theme for the image editor in Google Photos. At the time, enabling this look took some tinkering â€” but now, the new light theme is rolling out publicly in multiple versions of the Photos Android app. The editing view for Google Photos has historically featured a dark gray background. Thatâ€™s easier on the eyes when using your phone in a dark room, but it might not always be what you want. After an apparent server-side update thatâ€™s hitting users this week, that background will match your device theme: dark gray on dark mode, light gray for light mode.

items.title: A major Pixel-exclusive security feature could be the Galaxy S26â€™s secret weapon
items.summary: Evidence suggests Google's AI-powered Scam Detection could finally break its Pixel exclusivity for Samsung's next flagship.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR New code suggests Google is bringing its AI-powered Scam Detection feature to the Galaxy S26 series, potentially ending Pixel exclusivity. Model numbers for the Galaxy S26, S26 Plus, and S26 Ultra were discovered alongside Pixel codenames in the Google Phone app in code related to the Scam Detection feature. It is currently unclear if Samsung will replace its own dialer with the Google Phone app or if the feature will work as a user-installed app. One of the best Pixel features is Scam Detection . Introduced with the Pixel 9 series, Scam Detection notifies users about potential scams as they occur. This is done for phone calls, text messages , and even chat apps . So far, Scam Detection has been a Pixel-only feature, but it seems the feature could finally be losing that exclusivity, potentially starting with the upcoming Galaxy S26 series. items.title: Google Photos wants you to star in your own memes
items.summary: No one asked for this, but you'll probably try it anyway.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google Photosâ€™ new Me Meme feature uses AI to create personalized memes. It works with selfies and meme templates inside the Photos app. The feature is now rolling out for users in the US. Did you ever want to be the distracted boyfriend looking over his shoulder? Or the â€œchange my mindâ€ guy sitting smugly with his coffee? Google Photos is about to flex its AI image-generation muscles to give you that chance, with its new Me Meme feature now rolling out. The feature was announced in a post on Googleâ€™s support forums by a member of the Google Photos team, who describes Me Meme as a quick way to turn your own photos into shareable meme images using generative AI. Itâ€™s rolling out now to users in the US and lives directly inside the Photos app.

items.title: Hereâ€™s an early look at the upcoming search feature in Google Wallet
items.summary: Besides payment methods, you will also be able to search your recent transactions.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google Walletâ€™s search function could roll out soon, and weâ€™re bringing you an early preview. Besides a fully working search interface, weâ€™re also seeing suggested payment methods and loyalty cards. Google is also likely to integrate the promised transaction history into search. For many of us, Google Wallet has become the ever-growing storehouse for not just our credit or debit cards but also our passes, IDs, vouchers, and virtually everything else that needs to be conserved digitally. However, as it grows, it becomes increasingly difficult to manage or sort, which is why Google has been building search functionality for Wallet for quite some time. A little over a year ago, we saw Walletâ€™s Search UI in its early form . Now, weâ€™re getting a preview of a more functional version, along with elements that align with Googleâ€™s Material 3 Expressive philosophy. items.title: Another popular Android brand is making its own Bluetooth and UWB smart tag
items.summary: The Xiaomi Tag has been spotted in leaked renders, and it could come in UWB and Bluetooth-only variants.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR Evidence from Hyper OS suggests Xiaomi is developing its first item tracker, the Xiaomi Tag. The Xiaomi Tag will likely use a CR2032 battery and may come in two versions, including one with Ultra-Wideband (UWB). A global launch is not yet confirmed, but if it pans out, it could potentially democratize Bluetooth trackers and significantly boost Androidâ€™s Find Hub network. Weâ€™ve seen a handful of Android-compatible Bluetooth trackers released over the years, but the market is largely untapped, if Appleâ€™s success with AirTags is any indication. Motorola recently announced its Moto Tag 2 tracker, but thereâ€™s still plenty of space in the market for other Android brands to launch their offerings. It seems Xiaomi has decided to finally enter this space, as a new leak shows off the upcoming Xiaomi Tag. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Iâ€™ve been a OnePlus fan for 12 years, but this latest update is my breaking point
items.summary: The old OnePlus is gone and the anti-rollback measures prove it.
items.body: For the better part of a decade, a OnePlus phone has found its place in my pocket. When someone asked me for a recommendation â€” be it someone looking to upgrade to a no-nonsense, feature-packed smartphone, or a tinkerer looking for a platform to play around with â€” my answer was always a OnePlus smartphone . Between the great hardware, clean software out of the box, and a price tag that skirted well below other flagships, it was the safe recommendation. However, more than that, a OnePlus smartphone has traditionally been a smartphone that was, more or less, fully under your control. If the phone was out of the software update guarantee period, you could install a custom ROM to breathe new life into it. If you didnâ€™t like a software update, you could revert to the previous version. Or, if you just wanted to tinker around with hardware you owned, you could. Unfortunately, thatâ€™s no longer the case.

items.title: I made Now Brief useful for a day, and it was more effort than it was worth
items.summary: Every day, I mourn the loss of Google Now.
items.body: Itâ€™s been almost a year since the Galaxy S25 series launched, and one of the features Samsung made a big deal about at the time was Now Brief, which is supposed to provide an AI-powered snapshot of your day by pulling in data from your calendar, the weather, Samsung Health, and more. Weâ€™ve been less than impressed with Now Brief , finding that it rarely has anything of use to show you. On a recent work trip to London, I decided to put some effort into making it useful, and to my surprise, I was successful. Now Brief tries to be a travel companion Of all of the things Now Brief is supposed to be able to do, I wanted it to show me ETAs for upcoming events. The idea is simple â€” Now Brief looks at calendar events with a tagged location, checks where you are, and then works out when you should leave to get there on time. If that sounds familiar to you, thatâ€™s probably because thatâ€™s one of the many useful things that Google Now did back in the day.

items.title: Google Photos could soon TikTok-ify your video feed
items.summary: And help organize videos in your Photos backup with AI.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing an AI-powered feed for â€œRelatedâ€ videos. The feature uses AI to organize videos in a vertically scrolling feed. A new image editor theme is also rolling out in Google Photos. One of my favorite features in the Google Photos app is the frequent nudges about precious moments through AI-powered Memories . While Memories focuses mostly on images, Google is working on a comparable feature, specifically to help you discover videos with common elements. items.title: Iâ€™ve tested countless gaming devices, and these are gaming phones Iâ€™d recommend in 2026
items.summary: The best gaming device is always the one you have with you, so make the right choice.
items.body: Mobile gaming has come a long way in recent years, with console-quality titles regularly appearing on the Play Store, and new chipsets capable of emulating a large portion of my Steam library. Iâ€™ve tested countless games and phones (not to mention dedicated Android gaming handhelds ), and Iâ€™ve honed in on what separates the best from the rest when it comes to mobile gaming. Depending on what youâ€™re looking for, the options below represent the top gaming phones I recommend in 2026. REDMAGIC 11 Pro: The best gaming phone overall If you want the best performing gaming phone on the market, look no further than the REDMAGIC 11 Pro. I was blown away by the performance on the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5, and itâ€™s the only phone Iâ€™ve tested so far that can handle the thermal load of Qualcommâ€™s latest chipset. The realme GT8 Pro provided wildly inconsistent results under stress, and the OnePlus 15 simply shut down in the middle of our benchmark test (although this was fixed in later updates ).

items.title: With two 200MP cameras and a zoom accessory, this Ultra flagship could be the next camera king
items.summary: New Find X9 Ultra leak reveals renders and a powerhouse spec sheet, featuring a giant battery and a 300mm lens extender.
items.body: Credit: Paul Jones / Android Authority TL;DR Newly leaked renders show off the upcoming OPPO Find X9 Ultraâ€™s dual-tone design. The flagship is expected to sport a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip, a massive 7,300mAh battery, and a 6.82-inch 2K flat AMOLED display. Leaks also point to a 200MP Sony main sensor and a 200MP telephoto lens that reaches 13.2x optical zoom via a 300mm extender accessory. OPPOâ€™s upcoming Find X9 Ultra flagship was spotted with its insane 300mm telephoto extender accessory earlier this week, but we didnâ€™t get a good look at the phoneâ€™s back. A new leak is now sharing Find X9 Ultra renders, along with a detailed list of key specifications. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: I fell out of love with smart home tech years ago, but now Iâ€™m giving it a second chance
items.summary: Smart home tech has matured a lot, but will I stick around this time?
items.body: Credit: Brady Snyder / Android Authority I first got into smart home technology around 2015, right as smart speakers and connected devices started going mainstream. Within a few years, my home was filled with smart bulbs, cameras, speakers, switches, and just about anything else that promised automation or voice control. By late 2020, I had mostly abandoned it all. The novelty wore off, the maintenance piled up, and the conveniences no longer felt worth the effort. Now, several years later, I have slowly started to bring smart home tech back into my life. The question is whether the experience has actually improved enough this time to make it stick.

items.title: Googleâ€™s secret $800 million Epic partnership is a massive plot twist in the Android antitrust saga
items.summary: Epic and Google quietly struck an $800 million pact â€” now the judge wants answers.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A secret, $800 million partnership between Google and Epic Games was exposed in court this week. Epic will pay Google for services; Google gets deeper access to Unreal Engine and will help promote Epicâ€™s products on Android. Judge James Donato questioned if this deal diluted Epicâ€™s fight for broader Android reforms. After years of heated antitrust battles , Google and Epic Games have shocked the tech world with a secret, massive partnership now coming to light. The surprise was revealed during this weekâ€™s court hearing, when it emerged that the two rivals had agreed to an $800 million, six-year strategic partnership, The Verge reports. Epicâ€™s CEO Tim Sweeney hinted at the news on X , calling it â€œspicy details from the Epic v. Google settlement hearing!â€

items.title: Samsung admits liability in exploded Galaxy S25 Plus case, user claims (Updated: New Statement)
items.summary: The company is offering to compensate the user and cover their medical expenses.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A two-month-old Galaxy S25 Plus exploded while charging in November 2025, and the affected user reports that Samsung has now admitted liability. The company has reportedly agreed to cover the cost of the phone, medical bills, and cleanup, and has offered $500 per person for pain and suffering. Weâ€™ve verified the userâ€™s claims, including the report from the local fire department and Samsungâ€™s offer. Samsung has also shared a statement with Android Authority, stating that its analysis concluded that external force was the cause of the incident. Update: January 23, 2025 (1:36 AM ET): Samsung has now shared an amended statement with us, attributing the incident to â€œexternal force.â€ Since the fire departmentâ€™s investigation concluded that a thermal runaway event occurred, and per the userâ€™s testimony, the phone was simply charging when the incident occurred, itâ€™s unclear what the company means by referring to external force as the cause of the incident. Hereâ€™s the full, amended statement Samsung shared with us:

items.title: Google Home is making it simpler to add new devices
items.summary: More options to get all your plugs and lightbulbs online.
items.body: TL;DR A new device setup workflow is rolling out in Google Home. You can now search for apps and devices to add by name from inside Google Home. We first previewed this update late last year, and itâ€™s now generally available. Back in October, we got an early look at a new device setup workflow in Google Home. The revamped workflow gives you more ways to connect to third-party devices, letting you search by brand name to find both apps and devices to connect to Googleâ€™s smart home platform. Now, it looks like that update is finally rolling out. Weâ€™ve started seeing this setup process on our own devices with public-facing builds of the Google Home app. Previously, to pair a smart device with Google Home, you had to either scan a QR code on the device or hope Home could detect the presence of a device that hasnâ€™t been configured. With this new workflow, if neither of those are an option, you can type out the name of the specific device you want to get online to initiate pairing.

items.title: Waze could finally be ready to roll out these features weâ€™ve been waiting on since 2024
items.summary: Waze users will soon get toll booth warnings, emergency vehicle alerts, and more.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Waze has sent out an email to users about upcoming features. Five features were highlighted in the message, including warnings for speed limit decreases, emergency vehicles on your route, and more. These are all features that were previously announced, but it appears Waze is hinting that itâ€™s ready to roll these features out widely. If youâ€™re a Waze user, get ready for the navigation tool to get a little more helpful. It appears that several new features will be coming to the app soon. The company says that these features will help make your drive smoother and safer. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Android may be the first official US state smartphone platform
items.summary: State birds are so old-fashioned â€” get ready for official state smartphones.
items.body: TL;DR Utah is considering legislation that would designate Android as the state mobile operating system. Itâ€™s not yet clear if thereâ€™s any real support behind this effort, but if there is, it could become official by as soon as May. Life must have been a lot simpler 100 years ago. Not easier , certainly, but definitely without so many modern-day distractions. Back in 1926, lawmakers in Kentucky first got it into their heads to nominate a bird â€” the northern cardinal â€” as their stateâ€™s official avian ambassador, and pretty much everybody followed that lead with a state bird of their own . Now in 2026, when thereâ€™s clearly nothing more pressing for politicians to be worrying about, weâ€™re hearing about the first nomination of an official state smartphone platform . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Survey reveals the one habit most language learners have in common
items.summary: When it comes to language learning apps, it turns out that our readers are impressively consistent.
items.body: Credit: Stephen Headrick / Android Authority I came to Duolingoâ€™s defense back in April, after many of you told us in a poll that you donâ€™t think language learning apps work. Despite how they divide opinion, the majority of you in that survey did think they offered some benefit, and Duolingo is far from the only option on the market. Whichever you favor, we wanted to know more about your habits, so we polled you again on how often you actually engage with your language learning app of choice. That question was prompted by Stephen Headrickâ€™s recent article about trying Speak , a Duolingo alternative that takes a very different approach to language learning. Rather than leaning heavily on gamified drills and fill-in-the-blank exercises, Speak puts speaking front and center, using AI-powered conversations to push you to actually say things out loud. Stephen found that focus particularly useful for building his confidence to practice in the real world.

items.title: Forget smart speakers â€” Nintendoâ€™s chatty new gadget will talk to you all day long
items.summary: You can talk back, but it won't hear you.
items.body: TL;DR Based on the character from Super Mario Bros. Wonder, Nintendoâ€™s new Talking Flower toy tells the time and talks at you throughout the day. Pre-orders are now open at $34.99. General availability starts in March. Need another device in your home to make noise at you throughout the day? Nintendoâ€™s got you covered. Following an initial tease in September, pre-orders are now open for the companyâ€™s Talking Flower toy. Based on a chatty character from Super Mario Bros. Wonder, the gadget will pipe up every half hour or so to tell you the time, quote lines from the game, or just kind of say whatever. An overview video published by Nintendo today explains what the Talking Flower can do. The video says that when active, the toy will talk â€œabout twice per hour.â€ Itâ€™ll say different things based on the time of day or the temperature of the room itâ€™s placed in, or on demand when you press its button. It seems, well, annoying â€” and if youâ€™ve played Wonder, youâ€™ll know thatâ€™s a faithful adaptation of the character.

items.title: Gemini may soon do for music what Nano Banana has done for making pictures
items.summary: You and Gemini could be making beautiful music together.
items.body: TL;DR Google already offers some AI music generation tools, like in the Pixel Recorder app or through Lyria in the Gemini API. Now it looks like Google could be getting ready to add music creation to the Gemini app. Music you make with Gemini would be stored with the rest of your content in My Stuff. Watching an epic action movie with the sound off just isnâ€™t the same â€” the right music can really elevate an experience to the next level. Not all of us are musically inclined, though, which is why we were so excited when Google introduced a new feature for its Recorder app with the Pixel 10 that used AI to help us create music . Late last year, we saw access extend to Pixel 9 handsets , and now weâ€™re checking out what could be an even bigger expansion for tools like this. A few months ago, back in September, Google rolled out a new feature for Meet called â€œAsk Gemini in Meet.â€ The feature was only available for Workspace Business Plus customers at the time. However, the Google Meet feature will soon expand to more users. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: You donâ€™t have to wait for launch day to try Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Z TriFold
items.summary: The device will be available to experience in a small number of US Samsung stores from tomorrow.
items.body: TL;DR Samsung says that consumers can experience the Galaxy Z TriFold from tomorrow. The device will be on display at select Samsung Experience Stores, mostly located in California, New York, and Texas. The US launch date is yet to be officially announced. Whatever your opinion of a triple-panel phone, you might still be curious to check one out for yourself. In the case of the Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold , that doesnâ€™t mean you have to wait for the as-yet-unannounced US release date or spend a small fortune to order one when that date comes. Samsung says the Galaxy Z TriFold will be available to experience in person across the US starting tomorrow, ahead of its official US launch. The announcement comes via Samsungâ€™s US Newsroom , which says the device will be on display at a limited number of Experience Store locations. Itâ€™s not the launch, but it does mark the first time most US customers will be able to get hands-on with Samsungâ€™s most experimental foldable without traveling overseas or attending an industry event.

items.title: Google Search now knows what you did last summer, thanks to Gmail and Photos integration
items.summary: Googleâ€™s AI-powered Search now remembers your plans, purchases, and preferences.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is extending Personal Intelligence from Gemini to AI Mode in Search. AI Mode in Search now blends public web results with your private context from Gmail and Photos to deliver answers tailored to you. Personal Intelligence is fully opt-in, with clear controls to connect or disconnect Gmail and Photos at any time. Last week, we saw Google finally tackle the context packing problem by bringing Personal Intelligence to the Gemini app , allowing the AI to actually remember details about your life instead of just fetching single files. Now, Google is bringing that same memory upgrade to the search bar. Starting today, Google is expanding Personal Intelligence to AI Mode in Search . Search used to focus on indexing the worldâ€™s information, but now it can understand your own information. It combines public web results with your private data to give you answers that fit you.

items.title: Your Android phone can now keep receipts of exactly how it was hacked
items.summary: Googleâ€™s intrusion logging is finally here, and itâ€™s a game changer for Android security.
items.body: TL;DR Googleâ€™s Intrusion Logging is now live on some devices running Android 16. Once enabled, Android records key activity so you can check what happened if your phone is compromised. Youâ€™ll see intrusion logging when setting up Device Protection, and you can opt in or skip it. Google is changing how mobile security works with the new Intrusion Detection feature , which helps you see exactly what happened if someone gains access to your device. This feature is now rolling out to some devices, months after it was first announced, and it could make a big difference for anyone concerned about compromised accounts. Intrusion logging is a new part of Androidâ€™s security tools and is now becoming available on actual devices. Earlier this month, we saw the feature in action for the first time. Now, itâ€™s showing up on devices with Android 16, like the OnePlus Pad 3 , as spotted by our colleague AssembleDebug. A Pixel user on Reddit also reported that the feature is live on their phone with Android 16 QPR2.

items.title: Animations in the Play Store looking different? You might be seeing this M3E change
items.summary: Googleâ€™s Expressive makeover continues as users begin to see more download and loading flair in the Play Store.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Some new Material 3 Expressive animations in the Google Play Store are rolling out now. The shape of the download progress ring around the app icons is changing, as is the loading icon when switching pages. This looks to be a staged rollout by Google, so you might not spot it on your device for a while. Google has spent the past year slowly threading Material 3 Expressive through Android and its first-party apps. Some of the changes are nothing short of an overhaul, whereas others are relatively minor shifts in colors or icons. The Google Play Store appears to be the latest app to get a subtle facelift, with new expressive download and loading animations now starting to show up for some users. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Tired of Spotifyâ€™s mixes? Prompted Playlist lets you generate new ones on the fly
items.summary: Just tell the app what you want to hear.
items.body: TL;DR Spotifyâ€™s new Prompted Playlist feature creates custom playlists from text prompts. The prompts can be as general or specific as you want. Prompted Playlist debuted in beta in New Zealand last month. Itâ€™s now expanding to the US and Canada. Last month, Spotify introduced a feature it calls Prompted Playlist . Prompted Playlist uses AI to generate custom playlists based on your text input, which can be as broad or specific as you like. The feature has been exclusive to testers in New Zealand, but today, Spotify announced that Prompted Playlist is rolling out in beta in the US and Canada. As described in a new blog post from Spotify , Prompted Playlist can make just about any playlist you could think up. You can ask for tracks from a specific genre or set of genres, tracks originally released within a specific span of time, tracks that Spotify has tagged as matching a certain mood â€” if you can describe a playlist, Prompted Playlist can make it.

Modern software is never truly â€œdone.â€ With the days of physical media far behind us, and digital distribution the not-even-new-anymore normal, if youâ€™re not constantly updating your app, you may as well have abandoned it. Google devs are constantly tweaking the companyâ€™s core suite of Android apps, always trying out new workflows and UI optimizations . items.title: You might need to argue with Gemini to get it to work on Google Home
items.summary: The new Gemini upgrade for Google Home can gaslight and refuse simple commands, until you prod it a little.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A Reddit user reported that Gemini for Home initially refused to play white noise, claiming it could only broadcast messages. The AI assistant eventually performed the task after the user encouraged it, highlighting a â€œgaslightingâ€ trend in modern AI. While Gemini in Google Home excels at context, it often struggles with basic commands that the original Google Assistant handled easily. Gemini is slowly but surely replacing Google Assistant throughout Googleâ€™s smart home ecosystem. While we wait for a broader rollout, most Google Home users just want the basics to work again. Unfortunately, Google still has some work to do, as Gemini for Home sometimes ends up gaslighting users about what it can and cannot do, as one Reddit user found out. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Weird bug on Pixelâ€™s Phone app might be leaking your audio during voicemails
items.summary: And it sounds like a privacy nightmare.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Googleâ€™s â€œTake a Messageâ€ feature on Pixel phones is not functioning as intended. Instead of recording the callerâ€™s message as a voicemail, it may allow them to hear you in the background. The bug appears to affect all supported Pixel phones, starting with the Pixel 4. If you have no time to go through all your voicemails, Googleâ€™s â€œTake a Messageâ€ feature for Pixel devices can be really useful. If you miss or decline a call, Take a Message can automatically spin into action, informing the caller that youâ€™re unavailable and asking them to record a message. While it sounds like voicemail, the feature uses AI to transcribe the message and automatically store it in your Pixelâ€™s call history, where you can revisit it later. While Take a Message was initially launched with the Pixel 10 series , Google promptly made it available on older devices as well. While very useful in theory, it has reportedly been malfunctioning, letting callers hear you instead of recording their message. Several users have highlighted this issue with Take a Message on their Pixel phones over the last few months. These reports, spotted by 9to5Google , are not limitedâ€¦

items.title: If OnePlus is in trouble, the OnePlus 13 and 15 show exactly why
items.summary: How can OnePlus find and lose its form so quickly?
items.body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority Fans may be breathing a sigh of relief that reports of OnePlus preparing to wind down global operations seem to be inaccurate . But even before this rumor, there have been creeping indications that at least some changes are afoot. At the very least, the OnePlus, OPPO, and realme trio appear poised for yet another disruptive reshuffle, and thatâ€™s never reassuring. â€œ realme by OPPO â€ appears to the new name to give its budget segment a shot in the arm, while itâ€™s reported that the OnePlus 15s and Open 2 have been cancelled , a clear sign of belt-tightening if there ever was one. Something is going on over at BBK headquarters, but you donâ€™t need rumors and insider reports to be a little worried about one of Androidâ€™s vintage brands. A quick look at OnePlusâ€™ recent flagships is enough to raise eyebrows alone.

items.title: You voted on the best Android apps and games of 2025, and it wasnâ€™t even close
items.summary: A fun app and a legendary game ran away with your reader polls.
items.body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority Android apps and games are our bread and butter, so weâ€™re constantly investigating which ones might actually be worth your time. But as much as we like naming our own favorites, weâ€™re always more interested in hearing what you think. Thatâ€™s why, after rounding up our favorite Android apps and mobile games of 2025, we put them to a vote. In both cases, a clear winner emerged. The apps poll was based on Andy Walkerâ€™s roundup of his favorite Android apps of 2025 , a list that mixed new releases with apps he simply discovered this year. He focused on apps that might not be on your radar, and it leaned heavily toward tools that improve daily life in some way, though there were some fun choices in there, too.

items.title: Samsung confirms Galaxy Watch bug is breaking Do Not Disturb, but hereâ€™s a fix
items.summary: Galaxy Watch Do Not Disturb keeps turning off after the One UI 8 update.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Do Not Disturb is currently broken on Galaxy Watches after the One UI 8 update, with the setting turning itself off when enabled from the watchâ€™s quick panel. Samsung has confirmed the bug, which affects multiple models, from the Galaxy Watch 4 through the Watch 8. While Samsung is working on a permanent fix, you can avoid the bug by turning on DND through the watchâ€™s full settings menu. If you own a Galaxy Watch and want some peace and quiet, you might have noticed a new problem after the latest One UI 8 update for Samsung phones . When you turn on Do Not Disturb from the watchâ€™s quick settings, it switches off again after a few seconds. Samsung has confirmed the problem, which affects many models from the Galaxy Watch 4 up to the Watch 8 (via SammyGuru ). Multiple users have reported the issue on the Samsung Community forum .

items.title: The Galaxy A57 proves Samsung gave up on its flagship Galaxy S phones
items.summary: Samsung is bringing meaningful upgrades where it wants, but not to the Galaxy S or S Plus.
items.body: Rumors around Samsungâ€™s upcoming midrange Galaxy A57 have been circulating for months, but the last few weeks gave us more clarity about what to expect, including a full-blown spec sheet that shows an impressive set of features like 45W charging and a large 4,900mAh battery in a slim 6.9mm body. All of this is excellent news for the Galaxy A57, but guess what? These upgrades trample all over the upcoming Galaxy S26 and S26 Plus. This got me thinking: Has Samsung essentially given up on its Galaxy S series? Not the Ultra, of course, but the basic S and S Plus models? Is innovation dead for these phones?

items.title: Whatâ€™s the best fitness tracker of 2026? Iâ€™ve tested more than I can count, these are my top picks
items.summary: The right device depends on your priorities.
items.body: Though the line between smartwatch and fitness tracker continues to blur, there are still some devices that, first and foremost, deliver a dedicated wellness experience. Whether a band or a watch, these fitness trackers help users focus on building better habits, keeping tabs on their health, and generally staying active. As Android Authority â€˜s seasoned wearables expert, Iâ€™ve tested numerous trackers for years, pushing the limits of sensors, features, batteries, and build quality. Below are the top devices I would recommend to anyone looking for the best fitness tracker available. Fitbit Charge 6: The best fitness tracker overall (band-style) The best band-style fitness tracker comes from one of the oldest players in the game, Fitbit. Though now acquired by Google, the platform still offers fantastic wellness tracking and a user-friendly companion app. The Fitbit Charge 6 offers key upgrades to the fan-favorite Charge line. Most importantly, I have found the lightweight tracker extremely comfortable for workouts and sleep, and I love the colorful AMOLED display for reading stats. The latest model reintroduced a physical button to streamline device interaction, which makes navigatâ€¦

items.title: Forget tempered glass: The Galaxy S26 Ultra may debut a tougher new Gorilla Glass
items.summary: Samsung's upcoming Ultra flagship could make screen protectors obsolete.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR The Galaxy S26 Ultra is now rumored to feature a new generation of â€œultra-high strengthâ€ Gorilla Glass. The phone is also rumored to include built-in privacy display technology and an improved anti-reflective coating. These upgrades seemingly aim to eliminate the need for users to apply aftermarket tempered glass screen protectors. The Samsung Galaxy S26 series is still a little while away, but from leaks so far, the Galaxy S26 Ultra is shaping up to be the phone to get from the lineup. Samsung accidentally leaked its upcoming Privacy Display feature yesterday, and today, a new leak suggests we could be getting a new generation of Gorilla Glass on the Galaxy S26 Ultra. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: I tried out Mintâ€™s home internet service to find out if itâ€™s actually worth it
items.summary: If you live in the right area and have modest data needs, it really is a solid offer.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Mint Mobile first announced plans to enter the wireless internet market late last year, eventually rolling out service in October . The companyâ€™s so-called Minternet service is built on the same network and technology as T-Mobile 5G Home Internet, though its pricing and plan structure work a bit differently. Iâ€™ve spent the last two weeks testing out the service personally to see if itâ€™s actually any good. There are certainly some compelling reasons to consider the service, though itâ€™s not without its downsides either. The biggest question is who it is for, and whether its trade-offs are worth it for most users.

items.title: As a Pixel fan, I still have one big concern about the Pixel 10a
items.summary: 8GB of RAM is not going to cut it in 2026.
items.body: Last yearâ€™s Pixel 9a was a phone that checked almost every box. For $499, its combination of practical hardware, great cameras, excellent software, good battery life, and seven years of software updates was almost too good to be true. But it was true, and the Pixel 9a emerged as one of Android Authorityâ€™s highest-reviewed phones of 2025. As the Pixel 10a has leaked over the past couple of weeks, itâ€™s become increasingly obvious that it wonâ€™t be a dramatic upgrade over its predecessor. And thatâ€™s not necessarily a bad thing! So long as the 10a addresses the few lingering issues of the 9a, we could be looking at another top-tier budget Android phone.

items.title: Itâ€™s time to give up on Motorola smartwatches
items.summary: Seriously, just buy a Pixel Watch or something.
items.body: Motorola is no stranger to launching smartwatches. Itâ€™s launched one or two each of the last few years, sometimes under its own umbrella and sometimes licensed through CE Brands (now Vitalist Inc.). And yet, you might not have realized itâ€™s done anything in the wearable space since it tried to reboot the Moto 360 several years ago. Thatâ€™s how forgettable the Moto Watch experience has been. Somehow, though, Iâ€™ve always held out hope that something good was on its way. Until now. With yet another Motorola wearable on the horizon, Iâ€™ve decided itâ€™s finally time to give up. I donâ€™t think the Moto Watch will ever figure out its true identity, and I think itâ€™s time we all moved on. Hereâ€™s why.

items.title: Still donâ€™t have the Pixel January 2026 update? Youâ€™re not alone!
items.summary: The January 2026 update has dragged on for some Pixel users for reasons unknown.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR After more than 10 days of Google releasing the latest Android 16 update, many Pixel owners report not having received it. The majority of the complaints come from Pixel 8, Pixel 9, and Pixel 10 users. The reports come from different parts of the world and are not limited to a specific carrier or region. Google was already later than usual when it rolled out the January 2026 update for supported Pixel devices . Perhaps it was a holiday hangover still lingering. But despite the rollout having been initiated over 10 days ago, many Pixel users still donâ€™t have the update. Subreddits dedicated to Pixel phones are rife with users complaining they havenâ€™t received the January update yet. These complaints span across multiple Pixel devices, but weâ€™re seeing the majority of reports for the Pixel 8 and the Pixel 10 series. And these reports are consistent, regardless of whether their devices are unlocked or tied to a carrier. A handful of reports also hint at Pixel 9 or 9a not having received the update either.

items.title: Incident report regrets? Google Maps prepares a much-needed fix
items.summary: You'll soon be able to nuke all your submitted incident reports.
items.body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR Google Maps v26.04.01 includes code for a new feature that will let users delete all their contributed incident reports. The option will likely be under Settings > Location & Privacy, and accessing it will remove the association between your submitted reports and your account. Additionally, the â€œContributeâ€ tab could also receive a UI update that harmonizes colors and hides the bio input box for existing profiles. Part of what makes Google Maps such an excellent tool for travel and commuting is the abundance of crowd-sourced data. Features like incident reports help add a layer of real-time, community-based input to the navigation service. However, users have little control over the incident reports theyâ€™ve submitted, as there is no option to delete them later. Incident reports â€œfadeâ€ over time as other users confirm or deny them, but, generally speaking, thereâ€™s no way to delete submitted reports. That could soon change, as Google Maps v26.04.01 includes code suggesting Google could soon let users delete all their contributed reports across incidents, road conditions, transit, and trip issues. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --â€¦

items.title: Your T-Mobile bill is going up for the second time in a year
items.summary: But customers on older plans will be spared.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is increasing its monthly bill by $0.50 per line for certain users. The increase is part of T-Mobileâ€™s Regulatory Programs & Telco Recovery Fee, which is now $4.99 a month. This is the second hike of $0.50 since last year, but youâ€™ll be spared if your monthly plan already includes federal taxes and telco fees. If youâ€™re a T-Mobile customer in the US , your bill just went up overnight. Thatâ€™s because the carrier is adding an auxiliary charge, separate from your monthly payment plan. As of Wednesday, January 21, T-Mobile is increasing its â€œRegulatory Programs & Telco Recovery Feeâ€ to $4.99 per voice line and $2.10 per mobile data line. Thatâ€™s a $0.50 increase compared to before this date, when the fee per voice line was $3.99. If you have multiple lines in your plan, the total should reflect on your bill starting this month. T-Mobile updated its bill breakdown support page (via Droid-Life ) to reflect the new prices.

items.title: Did Google Home just break your smart lights? Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s going on
items.summary: Google has acknowledged the issue and is working on a fix.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The Google Home app has an issue thatâ€™s preventing some users from seeing their lights and switches as online. Multiple reports on Reddit confirm that lights, light groups, smart switches, outlets, and more are showing offline in the Google Home app. Google has acknowledged the issue and confirmed that itâ€™s working on a fix. Are your smart lights suddenly showing up as offline on the Google Home app? Youâ€™re not alone. It seems an issue with Google Home is causing users to see certain online devices as offline.

items.title: Hereâ€™s how Spotify pulled off a legal ambush to stop that 300TB dump of stolen music
items.summary: This is what a modern internet takedown really looks like.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Spotify and record labels quietly sued Annaâ€™s Archive, the shadow library that claimed to have scraped 300TB of Spotifyâ€™s most-played tracks. Annaâ€™s Archive was not even notified of the lawsuit until one of its primary domains was taken down from the internet. However, taking down a few domains hasnâ€™t stopped Annaâ€™s Archive. Like Hydra, the platform appears to regenerate as quickly as one of itâ€™s somains is cut back. Earlier this month, shadow library Annaâ€™s Archive, infamous for scraping 300TB of Spotifyâ€™s most played songs , suddenly lost its main .org domain. At the time, the siteâ€™s operator downplayed the situation, saying that domain takedowns for sites like theirs happen often . They insisted it had nothing to do with their recent scraping of Spotify at a massive scale. But unsealed documents now show how Spotify, along with top music labels, pulled off a legal ambush and shut down Annaâ€™s Archive.

items.title: Apple is picking up where Humane left off
items.summary: Apple could be next to try its hand at AI pin wearables.
items.body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Apple is working on an AI pin thatâ€™s said to be the size of an AirTag. The wearable reportedly features multiple cameras, a speaker, microphones, and wireless charging. Sources claim that the AI pin could launch in 2027. Even after the failure of the Humane AI Pin , it appears some companies still have not given up on the concept. One of the biggest names in the tech industry, in fact, is reportedly developing its own AI-powered wearable. Despite its struggles with the technology, Apple could expand its product line-up with an AI pin. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Nothingâ€™s Essential Space gets more useful by recognizing the connections between all your stuff
items.summary: Nothing's latest tweak to Essential Space takes the work out of finding related captures.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Nothingâ€™s Essential Space feature can now identify related captures and link them together. A â€œRelated Capturesâ€ category will appear below the capture youâ€™re currently looking at. This update is rolling out for the Nothing Phone 3, Phone 3a series, and the CMF Phone 2 Pro. Certain Nothing phones offer an AI-powered productivity hub known as Essential Space . As one of the companyâ€™s key features, it allows you to record video, capture screenshots, generate reminders, and more. The latest update to the app should help make it easier to find the captures youâ€™re looking for. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?
