items.title: Google is testing a colorful new feature for Search
items.summary: Google Search is getting a touch of color in latest test.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing theming and customization for Search. The new â€œColor your Searchâ€ feature allows you to choose between 10 accent colors. The feature appears to be available for large-screen devices and mobile. Update: January 21, 2026 (2:10 PM ET): We have now spotted the feature on smaller mobile devices. Original article: January 21, 2026 (1:52 PM ET): When it comes to Google Search , thereâ€™s not much you can do to customize its look. You can switch between light and dark modes, but not much outside of that. However, some users are getting a new feature that allows them to give the results page a fresh coat of paint.

items.title: Google Photos adds a sticker locker just to remind Android users what theyâ€™re missing
items.summary: Google Photos now lets you save custom stickers in Collections, so theyâ€™re reusable instead of one-and-done.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR You can now save custom stickers directly to the Collections tab in Google Photos. Despite being a Google product, the saving feature is currently live only on iPhone and iPad. Google says Android support is coming, with signs of active development, but thereâ€™s no release date. Google Photos has reached a creative milestone that many users have been waiting for. You can now save your custom stickers in Collections, making them easy to use in chats whenever you want. There is one catch, and itâ€™s a familiar one. The update is available on iOS, but Android users still do not have access, as per a Google Photos Community post .

items.title: Google Chat is just now getting a feature Teams and Slack have had for years
items.summary: A forward-looking update.
items.body: TL;DR Google Chat is adding the ability to forward messages. Users arenâ€™t able to forward internal chat messages to external users. The update is rolling out now on Rapid Release domains and coming to all users in February. Google Chat is finally getting message forwarding. Starting this week, Chat users will see a new â€œForward messageâ€ option in message action lists. Googleâ€™s also built in some clever protections to make sure you donâ€™t accidentally share info with the wrong people. In a blog post this week, Google outlined the new option. It appears when you click the three dots that appear when you click individual messages, just above the option to copy a link to that message.

items.title: Sonyâ€™s latest earbuds clip onto your ear like jewelry
items.summary: The new Sony LinkBuds Clip use a clip-on, open-ear design that lets you listen without blocking out the world around you.
items.body: Credit: Sony TL;DR Sonyâ€™s new LinkBuds Clip are open-ear earbuds that clip onto your ear rather than sit inside it. Theyâ€™re designed so you can hear your surroundings while listening, with three sound modes to suit your environment. Pricing starts at $229.99 in the US and $299.99 in Canada. Sony is back with another entry in its LinkBuds lineup, and this one is a slight departure from the traditional earbud design. The new LinkBuds Clip are open-ear earbuds that donâ€™t sit in your ear canal or hook over your ear. Instead, they clip onto your ear like a cuff, with the idea being that you can listen to music while still hearing whatâ€™s going on around you.

items.title: KONKR Pocket FIT backers can now redeem their compensation for shipment delays
items.summary: Pocket FIT Elite buyers get a gift pack in addition to the discount code.
items.body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR Crowdfunding backers of the KONKR Pocket FIT can now redeem a free $15 coupon. The coupon can be used on any product in the AYANEO store, with no minimum purchase requirement. The company also confirmed that all remaining Pocket FIT G3 orders from the Indiegogo campaign have shipped. AYANEO originally planned to start shipping the KONKR Pocket FIT in December 2025. However, the company ran into trouble and was forced to delay the shipping date. After explaining what went wrong, the handheld maker announced that all Pocket FIT buyers would receive a $15 store coupon. AYANEO has released an update regarding that coupon and the status of shipments. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: I relied on my Lenovo Smart Clockâ€™s touch controls for lights â€” now theyâ€™re gone
items.summary: It looks like Google Home's Gemini upgrade may have broken the Lenovo Smart Clock's best feature.
items.body: TL;DR The Lenovo Smart Clock used to let users quickly and silently toggle smart lights through its touchscreen interface. A few weeks back, that option seems to have gone away for everyone, replaced with an on-device â€œnightlightâ€ mode. While not yet confirmed, the timing of this change and the rise of Gemini for Home feel possibly related. Gemini has arrived for Google Home, and thatâ€™s changing the experience for users everywhere â€” for better or for worse. While Gemini offers the possibility of much richer AI interactions, users have been worried about losing valued functionality along the way, like Assistantâ€™s useful Continued Conversation mode. Googleâ€™s made a pretty strong commitment to supporting its older smart home hardware , but the question of third-party support has been less certain. Today weâ€™re checking out what appears to be one big downgrade thatâ€™s hitting just such a third-party device. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: YouTube TV multiview will finally be â€˜fully customizableâ€™ this year
items.summary: Following a more limited expansion last year.
items.body: TL;DR YouTube TVâ€™s multiview feature will soon be â€œfully customizable,â€ letting viewers add any stream. Multiview has historically been limited to a relatively small selection of channels. YouTube TV will also get several â€œspecializedâ€ new plans this year. YouTube TV has offered multiview â€” the option to watch multiple streams at once â€” since 2023. Multiview was exclusive to live sports streams until last year, when YouTube TV started allowing select non-sports content in multiview layouts. Today, YouTube announced that itâ€™s lifting more restrictions on the feature with an update in the near future. The announcement came in a blog post detailing YouTube â€˜s priorities for the year. The post doesnâ€™t get into specifics, only saying that this new â€œfully customizable multiviewâ€ is coming soon.

items.title: This smartphone runs Android, Linux, and even Windows 11
items.summary: NexPhone wants to rekindle the dream of a smartphone replacing your computer.
items.body: TL;DR For smartphone users looking for a desktop replacement, the NexPhone wants to offer a choice of three popular operating systems. In addition to desktop support for Android, Linux Debian, and Windows 11, thereâ€™s full mobile compatibility, including a custom Windows UI. Shipments are expected to get started in Q3 2026, with the hardware going for a reasonably affordable $549. Ever since smartphones started getting really powerful, some of us have been wondering why we need so many other computers in our lives. Instead of a smartphone, plus a laptop, and maybe even a desktop computer at home, couldnâ€™t we have this one convenient, portable handset just act as our primary computing device, and connect it to larger screens, keyboards, and mice as we liked? Companies have been trying to offer just that sort of experience for well over a decade now â€” to varying degrees of success â€” and now weâ€™re checking out the latest attempt from Nex Computer: the NexPhone . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Is Yahoo Mail down for you? Youâ€™re not alone (Update: Back online)
items.summary: The outage appears to also be affecting AOL and Yahoo.
items.body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR AOL appears to be experiencing an outage. The outage has taken down Yahoo and Yahoo Mail as well. Update: January 21, 2026 (10:44 AM ET): It appears that AOL, Yahoo, and Yahoo Mail are now starting to come back online. Original article: January 21, 2026 (10:04 AM ET): Are you unable to access your Yahoo Mail account this morning? Donâ€™t worry, everyone else is in the same boat today. It appears that AOL is currently experiencing an outage and that outage has taken down Yahooâ€™s services.

items.title: Which Galaxy S26 Ultra upgrade matters to you the most?
items.summary: Tell us which Gaaxy S26 feature could make you open up your wallet!
items.body: Credit: Android Headlines The Galaxy S26 Ultra, along with the smaller S26 and the S26 Plus, is expected to arrive next month . And while itâ€™s on track to launch as a new device, most people will agree it offers only minor improvements over the Galaxy S25 Ultra. That said, there are some new details rumored for the Galaxy S26 Ultra that could make it desirable to some users, whether they are using an older Samsung device or looking to switch from another phone brand. Irrespective of what we say, Samsung is already preparing to sell a boatload of Galaxy S26 Ultra units. It reportedly plans to produce roughly 3.6 million units for sale in the first wave after launch. Of course, not all upgrades will appeal equally to every buyer, and we want you to tell us which ones excite you.

items.title: Survey reveals the Pixel features Google fans want borrowed from rival phones
items.summary: Many of these aren't unreasonable asks in 2026.
items.body: The idea of the ultimate Google Pixel feature is difficult to envisage, because who knows what our smartphones will be capable of in five or ten years? However, when your flagship Pixel doesnâ€™t have a feature that another brand already offers, itâ€™s not unrealistic to hope that Google will introduce it to its own lineup sooner rather than later. With that in mind, we set out to discover which feature from another brand you want on your Pixel. Android Authority contributor Zac Kew-Denniss got the ball rolling by giving you some options. His article last month broke down the seven features from other phones he wanted to see on his next Pixel , and he turned that shortlist into a poll to see which ideas resonated most with you. His suggestions included everything from motion gestures to widget stacks, and you should check out his article to understand his reasoning. The poll also invited you to suggest your own ideas in the comments. Plenty of you weighed in, giving us a pretty clear picture of where Pixel fans think Google could up its game. Letâ€™s take a look at the results.

items.title: Android Auto music controls looking different? Google is finally rolling out the new UI
items.summary: The stable rollout of version 16.0 brings along the much awaited Media Playback template.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Android Auto 16.0 is finally rolling out in the stable branch, bringing the new Media Playback template to all users. The redesigned layout features a wavy progress bar and moves the play, pause, and track controls to the left. The uniform template will ensure a consistent experience across different media apps like Spotify and YouTube Music on the Android Auto platform. Google introduced the new Media Playback template for Android Auto last year, giving music player apps like Spotify and YouTube Music a consistent look and experience. More recently, the company updated the template with a new wavy progress bar , adding some visual flair. However, most users have not been able to enjoy the changes so far, as the changes have been under testing all this time. Thankfully, that is now changing, as the new Media Playback template is now rolling out to users in the stable branch. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
items.summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

items.title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
items.summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

items.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
items.summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

items.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
items.summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.
